meanings.definition: The amount of money regularly given to a person, typically a child, by a parent or guardian.
meanings.sent1: My mom gives me a weekly allowance for doing chores.
meanings.sent2: Children often receive an allowance for completing tasks around the house.
meanings.sent3: I saved up my allowance to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent4: Her allowance was like a treasure chest waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The shiny coins in my allowance jingled happily in my pocket.

meanings.definition: The amount of something that is permitted or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: There is a strict allowance of candy allowed per day.
meanings.sent2: The teacher set a limit on the daily allowance of snacks in class.
meanings.sent3: I exceeded my chocolate allowance and now feel sick.
meanings.sent4: His patience had reached its allowance for the day.
meanings.sent5: The allowance of mistakes in this test is very low.
